intro: Guatteria veneficiorum, commonly known as the poisonwood plant, is a member of the Annonaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish berry that contains several seeds. Despite its ornamental appeal, it is considered toxic due to the presence of various alkaloids in its leaves and bark.
